alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Waukesha (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 1:52PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Waukesha and northeastern Jefferson Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 151 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a broken line extending from Okauchee Lake to 8 miles west of Dousman. Movement was north at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. Accumulating small hail is possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Delafield, Okauchee Lake, Oconomowoc, Lac La Belle, Ixonia, Rome, Nashotah, Sullivan, Oconomowoc Lake, Chenequa, Mapleton, Stone Bank, Pipersville, Monterey, Lake Lac La Belle, and Summit. This includes Interstate 94 between mile markers 272 and 283. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
